thread.title: Royals set World Series rotation: Edinson Volquez to start Game 1
thread.title_full: Royals set World Series rotation: Edinson Volquez to start Game 1 - CBSSports.com

author: Mike Axisa
title: Royals set World Series rotation: Edinson Volquez to start Game 1
text:
Tuesday night at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, the 2015 World Series will begin between the Royals and Mets. The Royals are playing in the Fall Classic for the second straight season. The Mets? This is their first World Series trip since 2000.
Monday afternoon Royals manager Ned Yost announced his World Series rotation, one day after calling himself a " punk " for withholding the information. Edinson Volquez will get the ball in Game 1 Tuesday, and he'll be followed in order by Johnny Cueto , Yordano Ventura and Chris Young . Volquez, Cueto and Ventura would then come back for Games 5-7, if necessary.
Volquez, 32, started Game 1 of the ALCS against the Blue Jays and threw six shutout innings. He has a 4.32 ERA with an unsightly 15/12 K/BB in three starts and 16 2/3 innings this postseason. The Royals are 1-2 in Volquez's three October starts.
Starting Cueto in Game 2 allows him to make his two World Series starts -- again, assuming Game 6 is necessary -- at home in Kansas City. Cueto was more effective at home (4.50 ERA) than on the road (4.98 ERA) with the Royals after coming over from the Reds at the trade deadline.
Perhaps more importantly, pitching at home means Cueto won't have to deal with a ruthless road crowd. The "Cue-To! Cue-To!" mock chants were loud and clear at Rogers Centre in Toronto last week, and it appeared to affect him on the field. Cueto took a long time between pitches and was generally out of sorts.
Ventura, amazingly, has the most postseason experience of any starting pitcher in the World Series. He has eight career postseason starts (and one relief appearance) to his credit, during which he's posted a 3.98 ERA and a 35/17 K/BB in 43 innings.
The Mets announced their World Series rotation over the weekend . Here are the pitching matchups:
Game 1, Oct. 27 in KC: Volquez vs. Matt Harvey
Game 2, Oct. 28 in KC: Cueto vs. Jacob deGrom
Game 3, Oct. 30 in NY: Noah Syndergaard vs. Ventura
Game 4, Oct. 31 in NY: Steven Matz vs. Young
Game 5, Nov. 1 in NY*: Harvey vs. Volquez
Game 6, Nov. 3 in KC*: Cueto vs. deGrom
Game 7, Nov. 5 in KC*: Ventura vs. Syndergaard
* if necessary
Game 1 of the 2015 World Series will begin Tuesday night at 8pm ET. Edinson Volquez will start Game 1 of the World Series for the Royals. (USATSI) Topics: Chris Young , Edinson Volquez , Johnny Cueto , Yordano Ventura , Kansas City Royals , MLB
